comments:
build I20040330 + latest UI from head

- ran the StartupTest test class
- the tests passed, but I got the following in the console

This looks like a problem with the job manager itself.  It told a restartable
job to run, but then shut itself down while this job was running.

java.lang.IllegalStateException: Job manager has been shut down.
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.schedule(JobManager.java:623)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.InternalJob.schedule(InternalJob.java:246)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.jobs.Job.schedule(Job.java:351)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.views.markers.internal.TableContentProvider.doUpdate(TableContentProvider.java:396)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.views.markers.internal.TableContentProvider.access$4(TableContentProvider.java:344)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.views.markers.internal.TableContentProvider$3.run(TableContentProvider.java:182)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.views.markers.internal.RestartableJob$2.run(RestartableJob.java:86)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:62)

Actually, it may be a problem in the TableContentProvider since it looks like
it's  trying to schedule a different job.

Do all callers of schedule need to check that the job manager is still running?
Looks like same symptoms of bug 46958.

Whoever created this job should ideally be canceling the job before their plugin is
shutdown.  If jobs are still running after the runtime plugin shuts down, not
being able to schedule further jobs will be the least of your problems.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 57505 ***

traces.message: Job manager has been shut down.
